conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graphs to determine when objects are farthest apart.
Object A starts with negative velocity, increases linearly to zero at point A. Object B starts at zero, increases quadratically to maximum at point B.
Identify starting points: Both objects start from the same location with initial velocities.
Analyze Object A’s motion: Velocity increases linearly from negative to zero, stops momentarily at point A.
Analyze Object B’s motion: Velocity increases quadratically from zero to maximum at point B.
Determine maximum separation: Occurs when Object A has traveled maximum distance before stopping and Object B reaches peak velocity.
Calculate time: Maximum separation happens at intersection of paths at end of timeline.
Conclusion: Objects are farthest apart at time point where both have traveled maximum distances.
